moves.1. e4: This is a league game I played with Geronimo.
moves.3... e6: I'm not sure about this move. It's seems fine. Maybe a preventative move for the  Bishop coming out to f4?
moves.4. Nc3: Still allow the trade on d4.
moves.4... a6: I think this was another move keeping the bishop off this diagonal.
moves.5. d5: I had no intention of going to the b5 square.
moves.5... exd5 6. exd5 Nce7 7. Ne4 b6 8. Bd3:
White has better center control and is more developed.
But has missed mate in 1 for two moves!!
Quite the oversight!!
moves.9... d6 10. O-O Ng6: Black has now moved his Knight 3 times in the first 10 moves.
moves.11. Re1 Be7 12. Bg5 f6: I think black should have traded bishops here. Yes it would have been a discovered check for white, but black could simply bring out his other Knight. Allowing black to castle whenever he wants.
moves.13. Bh4 Qc7 14. Qa4+: With an idea of pushing out the black King.
moves.15... Ne5 16. Nxe5+ dxe5: Gaining some ground in the center. Good move. Also getting rid of another Knight that white had on a pretty good square.
moves.17. Nf5 Bf8 18. Rad1 g6 19. d6: This was probably a bad move for white.
moves.19... Qd8 20. Ng3: Now I have left that pawn hanging. As well as blocking in my own Bishop. That was OK with me though.
moves.20... g5 21. Bxg5 fxg5 22. Rxe5: I'm only down a pawn. This was more of a positional sacrifice.
moves.22... h6: Black still didn't take the pawn on d6?
moves.23. d7 Nf6 24. Rf5 Bg7 25. Be4 Qc7 26. Q: The Queen is not doing a thing on this side of the board.
moves.26... Rhd8 27. Qf3: White's pieces are much more active here.
moves.27... Rab8: Black not wanting to trade Bishops because of the Knight recapture on e4.
moves.28. Nh5 Bxe4: Now black feels safe taking the bishop.
moves.29. Rxf6+: And now it's already too late for black.
moves.29... Kg8: If black takes with his black Bishop then Qf6  followed by mate.
moves.30. Qxe4: It is still OK to give up the Rook here.
moves.30... Bxf6: Black not seeing the g4 square for the Queen.
moves.31. Qg6+:
It was forced mate from here. My opponent saw this and resigned.
GOOD GAME
